entry.title: Ordinals BIP PR
entry.summary:
In this email, Tim raises some important questions regarding Bitcoin Improvement Proposals (BIPs). He suggests that there should be a process to evaluate BIPs even before they become proposals. However, this idea presents several challenging questions. Firstly, who would be responsible for evaluating these proposals? There is a need to identify the individuals or group in charge of this task.
Another question raised by Tim is how to predict if a proposal will become a widespread standard. This is crucial as it determines whether a proposal will gain acceptance and adoption within the Bitcoin community. Additionally, Tim wonders about the core mission of Bitcoin and how to measure if something aligns with this mission. Defining the core mission provides guidance on which proposals should be considered relevant and beneficial to the Bitcoin ecosystem.
Lastly, Tim questions the composition of the entire Bitcoin community. It is essential to understand who constitutes the Bitcoin community in order to involve all relevant stakeholders in the evaluation process. By considering various perspectives and opinions, a more comprehensive assessment can be made.
Overall, Tim's email highlights the need for a structured evaluation process for BIPs. These questions serve as important considerations when determining the future direction and standards within the Bitcoin community.
